Share.d:
Use ChatGPT with Tasker!

Check out the Chat demo here!

Check out the Image Recognition demo here!

ChatGPT Usage Costs

The ChatGPT API is a paid service, but for Tasker uses it seems like a very cheap service. I've used it extensively in the creation of this project making more than 500 requests and I didn't even reach a $0.01 usage. It's still at $0.00. Ã°Å¸Ëœâ€¦.
To summarize, you do need to add a payment method, but you'll most likely end up paying very, very little, unless you use this a whole lot.

ChatGPT API Key Needed

Start by generating an API Key here so you have it handy to paste it into the prompt that shows up when you import this project.

Project Description

This project provides the basis of interaction with the ChatGPT API. Tasks that interact with the API or provide other "library" like help are marked with System >> in their names and are not supposed to be used by you directly, unless you want to create new functionality. If you do, check out how the tasks/profiles below are built so you know how to use these "System" tasks correctly.

Included Chat Tasks

These tasks and profiles in the project will give you a few examples on how you could use ChatGPT in Tasker:

  • Set Assistant Personality: aill allow you to set the general behaviour of the responses. For example, you could set it to something like 
    You are a very helpful assistant called "Happy GPT" that always introduces itself before its first response. You call people "Master" and treat them like queens or kings, always asking if they want you to make any offers to them.
    like in the demo video and make it behave that way.
  • Task - New Chat: will start a new chat with ChatGPT and then will continuously loop showing you answers and wait for another prompt from you with input dialogs.
  • Task - Continue Chat: will continue the last chat you were on, also with input dialogs.
  • Task - Voice Chat: will start a new chat where it'll ask you to say something out loud and it'll also respond out loud. It'll loop this interaction until you say "stop". Imporant Note: for this to work you need an API key to use the Say WaveNet action to generate more realistic voices. You can replace the Say WaveNet action in this task with a normal Say action if you want.
  • Summarize WhatsApp Notifications: will read your current WhatsApp notifications and summarize their text so that you can quickly and easily know which unread messages you have. Important Note: You need at least version 4.2.10 of AutoNotification for this to work. You may need to sign up for the beta.
  • Profile - Simple Chat Bot (don't enable profiles on import if you don't want this): every time you receive a message it'll send back a response from ChatGPT. To start a new conversation you have to receive a WhatsApp message with the text start, otherwise it'll continue on with the current conversation. This is a very rudimentary chat bot that's probably not very useful, but it can give you an idea of where to start building your own for your needs. Important Note: You need AutoNotification for this.

Included Image Recognition Tasks

The following tasks allow you to use ChatGPT's image recognition abilities:

  • Tasks - Question Photo and Question Photo Short Answer: will allow to take a photo and then ask a question about it with your voice. ChatGPT will analyse the photo and answer your question about it.
  • Task - Pick and Question Image: same as above, but instead of taking a photo, you'll be asked to pick an image on your Android device.

Important Note: To use image recognition capabilities you need to first setup a service that allows you to upload images to it and then serves those images in a publicly accessible URL. The Dropbox and Imgur projects allow you to that

If you want to use your own task to upload a file, set the %image_upload_task Project Variable to that task's name and make sure the task receives the local file path as Parameter 1 and returns the publicly accessible URL. Check the Dropbox or Imgur examples to see how it works.

Important Project Variables

  • Project Variable - %messages: Contains a JSON structure of the current conversation. The ChatGPT API requires you to always send all messages in the current conversation so it has context. If you don't send the full "thread", it won't have any context and won't recall past messages.Important Note: ChatGPT will charge you for how much text it sends back to you but also for how much text you send it, so keep that in mind when sending very large conversations.
  • Project Variable - %prompt: A description of the assistant's personality. You can easily change it with the Set Assistant Personality task described above.
  • Project Variable - %image_upload_task: Contains the name of the task that handles uploading of an image and returning a publicly accessible URL of the image.
  • Task Variable in task "System >> Send Chat" - %api_key: Contains your personal API Key. Don't share it with anyone.

Adding Tasks to Your Home Screen

Use the built-in tasks mentioned above by adding them to your home screen with the Tasker Shortcut widget (long-click home screen > add Widget)

If using Tasker 6.2 or above you can also open Tasker > go into the Task you want to add to your homescreen > Menu > Add To Launcher

ProfileVariable.pvd: A Prompt that defines what the chat Assistant behaves like. You can always reconfigure this by running the "Set Assistant Personality" task. Leave it empty to not set a Prompt.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%http_cookies Cookies The cookies the server sent in the response in the Cookie:COOKIE_VALUE format. You can use this directly in the 'Headers' field of the HTTP Request action</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%http_data Data Data that the server responded from the HTTP request.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2>%http_file_output File Output Will always contain the file's full path even if you specified a directory as the File to save.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3>%http_response_code Response Code The HTTP Code the server responded</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4>%http_headers() Response Headers The HTTP Headers the server sent in the response. Task.pc:
This task expects Parameter 1 to be set to the task name of a task that Uploads the given file and returns a Url of the uploaded file.
This task will then take a photo and upload the photo with the given task in Parameter 1.

If you want to use home screen buttons to trigger these ChatGPT Tasks:
- go to your home screen - long-click it - select something like "Add Widget" - select the "Tasker Shortcut" Widget - Select the task you want to add - repeat the process for any other tasks you want to add - if you want to use these in a folder drag them on top of each other

Action.Str:
The following are messages sent to me.
summarize them the best you can in the shortest way you can in 10 words or less but always mention the contact's name
Translate all messages to English is needed but don't mention the translation
"
You don't have any pending Whatsapp conversations.

Starting new conversation with this assistant:
"%prompt"

Vals.Title: <null>

A Prompt that defines what the chat Assistant behaves like.

Action.Str: Give me a very short answer: %par1
